CONS *Caesar Salad and Fries - Really the only negative I saw with this place was the Caesar salad and the fries. The Caesar salad was very dry and not very flavorful. They didn't really have caesar dressing, but just some parmesan cheese. Also, I wasn't the biggest fan of the fries, but to be honest, I've had much worse too.

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: David our waiter was amazing! Food was great  the Philly  was great, Chicken and Brie was great. Highly  recommend. Must try!

Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: Great gourmet burgers! We stopped here on a whim because we were looking for a place to eat and watch the Packer football game. There were two flat screen tv's above the bar showing the game with sound so we sat at the bar. They had a lot of good beers on draft for $6.  The bartender was super friendly and helpful. She explained the meat and how fresh it is (i think it's grass fed) and gave us recommendations. My brother got the beef southwest burger. It had pepperjack cheese, jalepeno bacon, and tortilla strip. He loved it! I had a beef greek burger which was uniquely served on pita bread topped with a cucumber greek salad and an amazing cucumber yogure sauce... OMG! The burgers are pretty big so I split an onion ring with my bro. They game with a chipotle aioli sauce I wanted to drink with a straw it was so good! LOL  They are a little pricey but well worth it! 2 burgers, an onion ring, and 6 beers came out to little over $60 bucks.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This place was hopping when we went! The burgers were great, and the fries as well.  The prices were decent and I really enjoyed my salmon/rock shrimp burger with remoulade sauce.  Great choice for people who like burgers = )

Reviews.Author: Erik
Reviews.Content: Great burgers. Lots of unique choices. This is a great place to go if you want a change from the norm. Plus, it's in NY NY on the strip!

Reviews.Author: Stephanie
Reviews.Content: We stopped by New York New York to pick up our Zumanity tickets and stumbled upon Broadway Burger Bar & Grill. It's located towards the back of the casino, close to the Zumanity theater. The whole decor of New York New York is a little kitschy but still cute!  We were promptly seated and our server was really sweet. She gave us plenty of time to look over the menu, which offers basic burgers, specialty burgers, salads, and tons of appetizers. We decided to share an order of chili cheese fries ($4.95) and also ordered the B 3 & G burger ($9.95) and B 3 & G turkey burger ($9.95). The burgers are only cooked two ways, pink or well-done.  We both really enjoyed our burgers, they were huge and very filling, but felt that the chili cheese fries were just okay. They gave us big portions though!  Overall, Broadway Burger Bar & Grill is a perfect spot for lunch in the casino and great for sharing.

Reviews.Author: MichelleMarie
Reviews.Content: Excellent everything. Hands down!   Even though the strip isn't a favorite of my family's to do anything on. I convinced my mother to come try Burger Bar for lunch after only being here once before. Loved it then and only love it 1,000xs times more now!  Cherese was our server and she was beyond amazing and helpful! Constantly making sure our drinks were filled and orders were perfect!!  We ordered a Caesar salad to start along with two build your own burgers! Veggie patty let me tell you. TOO DIE FOR!!!!   What else made this memorable is being approached by the General Manager Jeff! Just checking on everyone is a quality you don't see much these days! His smile and small talk definitely has us coming back to visit him and his amazing store!   Thank you so much for the awesome service Cherese and Jeff! You guys definitely made us think differently of visiting the strip. Even if maybe it is only for you guys from now on!

Reviews.Author: Literal-tequila
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at NYNY, which was our first time to stay there in Vegas.  We checked yelp and saw this place, so we decided to check out.  I don't eat beef, so I ordered vegitarian burger.  Oh boy, it was way salty and worst burger ever. My husband ordered Black and Blue burger.  He said meat was overdone and way too much salt.  Fries were too greesy and not even tasty.  We just had a couple of bites and left.  I wish I can give negative star.

Reviews.Author: Asha
Reviews.Content: We were at the New York New York for the Manhattan Express roller coaster... and after walking around so much, we were hungry.   We shared a hot dog and some fries. Both were edible/decent.. nothing special here.

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: You could do worse.    This place does what it's supposed to just fine.  It feeds you junk food.  To anyone with any other kind of expectation than that, you are in the wrong place, buddy.  Burgers, fries, fish sandwiches, pork rib sandwich, philly cheesesteak, hot dogs.  You can't really go wrong if you eat any of these things.  They all taste adequate and their fish sandwich is actually pretty tasty.  The food tastes fresh even though I am fairly certain it is not and I didn't puke afterwards.  That's all I want when I dine at places like these.  The prices are extremely fair compared to everything else on the strip so I give it 3 stars for that reason.

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: During a previous visit to Vegas, we had eaten here. My son likes it because if you sit in a certain section, you can briefly see the rollercoaster as it returns to the station. So, upon returning to the city, we had to make another stop.  Overall, it is a decent restaurant. The burgers are pretty good. I like that you can make them to order. Although they can get a little pricey if you start ordering sides, etc.  The staff has always been friendly and the food arrives pretty quick. Of course, there were not a lot of people there, so they should be able to get the food out in a timely manner!  And the best part...they were able to accommodate and allow us to sit in the area so that my kids could watch the rollercoaster.

Reviews.Author: Phoebe
Reviews.Content: Great find! My coworker and I were in town on business and stumbled across Broadway Burger Bar. I don't eat red meat and my coworker is gluten free -- sometimes we can be tough to please. But we were pleasantly surprised to find turkey burgers and gluten free options. Vegetarian and Pescatarian friendly too! Contrary to other reviews, the turkey burger was moist and flavorful -- there's also a ton of sauces and spicy options! The service was incredible (Lashawnda was awesome)! And you can't beat the prices (avg $10 for burgers.) I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: The food was accurate and well prepared and yummy. The best part was David who was engaged and helpful and friendly. He is a great marketing resource for Vegas.

Reviews.Author: VivaciousRhe
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was LOVELY.  The burgers are big and juicy (consider sharing). Cherese was are our awesome server. She was really patient with us and guided us in the right direction! Philly Cheesesteak burger is a MUST!!! Loaded fries - YUM!

Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: In a sea of expensive food options it was refreshing to find Broadway Burger Bar was fairly reasonable.   The burger options are great and feel the specials offer enough variety and a good value vs customizing your own.   Quality of the food is adequate, won't blow your mind but will do its job to satisfy you without over paying.   Overall Thoughts  I would say that if you are looking for a value option that isn't a chain or food court, Broadway is a good way to go

Reviews.Author: Gina
Reviews.Content: Love the garlic fries and burgers. All so fresh. Always get the cowboy, but don't forget to ask for pickles, lettuce, tomatoes and onions. The hamburger doesn't come with them.

Reviews.Author: Trevor
Reviews.Content: I just had a cheeseburger and fries here but I thought it was definitely 4 stars. My burger had lots of flavor and the fries were awesome. The only complaint that I have is that the bun was a little dry. A nice fresh bun would have elevated this to 5 stars...maybe next time. The service was adequate. Our waitress was a bit shy at first but she opened up a little by the end of our meal. If you are looking for a good old fashioned big hamburger and fries...I would recommend going here.

Reviews.Author: Cody
Reviews.Content: Food and service here was pretty good! Would recommend the BBQ Bacon Burger with a cold draft of your choice!

Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: Fantastic!! All the food I've tried here is great.  However this is the very best veggie burger I've ever tried!!  Ever!!   It's a grilled portobello mushroom patty. I'm by no means a vegetarian but this sammich is the best item on their menu.  Their onion rings are pretty tasty as are their fries.  The black and Bleu burger is also tasty but could use a little more flavor.

Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Had a better 6.00 dollar burger at a famous fast food chain.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: After gaming in NYNY one evening we decided to stop in here and ordered a cowboy and southwestern burger with a side of onion rings. As the other reviewers have said burgers are huge but nice and fresh and a decent price for somewhere on the strip. We also didn't wait too long for them which is always great. Service was good.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Food was great, service was awesome, the wait was not so good.  I'd give a 5 star review but for as few people as there were in the restaurant, it took an awful long time for our food to show up.  Overall we left happy but I can't help but get a bit discouraged especially when you're hungry.  Am I right or am I right or am I right?

Reviews.Author: Lex
Reviews.Content: Bought a greasy hotdog before entering Zumanity.

Reviews.Author: Mandi
Reviews.Content: The burgers and fries are amazing! They have a gluten free bun option, which always makes a Celiac happy! The server and manager were very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Sunny
Reviews.Content: Bland. No seasoning on meat. Medium burger was cooked too well done. Prices are decent. $10 for a burger. Burgers don't come with fries, you have to  add it on.

Reviews.Author: Consuelo
Reviews.Content: Had the b3 g burger. It was awesome. Super huge and filling. Don't order fries unless your starving. Burger filled me up

Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: Philly cheese steak burger and garlic fries were both amazing. My wife ordered the pork sliders and chicken wraps which also were great. Very friendly staff and a great happy hour prices.

Reviews.Author: Teri
Reviews.Content: If you want to eat grease this is the way to go. Got a portobello burger, thinking it would be a great healthy alternative, instead it was deep fried and tasted like a funnel cake. Great if you're into that, I am not. The sweet potato fries tasted good the cut fries were like downing oil with a potato taste. Also the honey mustard is a bottle of preservatives and, unsurprisingly, tastes terrible. I will admit I am extremely picky and health conscious, naturally it was an overall a disappointment.

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: It was good, not anything to rave about though.  The day we went, it was not too busy, it took a while to get our food. I can't say it was a horrible experience, we will probably try new places next time.

Reviews.Author: Alexander
Reviews.Content: The burgers, onion rings, and fries here are absolutely delicious and if you don't mind waiting a while to get them, you will be satisfied. Be prepared to spend a pretty penny as well, as a meal for 2 can quickly turn into $40+

Reviews.Author: Jodi
Reviews.Content: We had a late lunch here today and was pleasantly surprised.  The burgers are HUGE!  It was a perfect medium with lots of flavor.  Neither of us could finish our burger so when we got to the yummy, yummy fries it was impossible to eat them all.  An order of fries will easily suffice for two people.   They have a condiments menu on which you indicate which ones you would like brought to the table - it had a wide selection of mustard, hot sauces, steak sauces, etc.    We were seated quickly and had a great server, Shannon, who seem to know what we wanted before we did.  She has a strong knowledge of the menu and options and was very pleasant, even with all of my friend's questions and special requests.    We will definitely be back - next time I'm trying a turkey burger!

Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: The One Where Sarah Drags Sandy and Friends to get a Burger.  While in Vegas, we randomly were pushed towards a burger joint by my girlfriend ;)  She was craving for a burger and when she saw the neon lights, BAM! there we were... asking for a table for 6.  It was a pretty solid burger joint. I had their English Pub, which was recommended by the server.  Let me tell you, a burger with a fried egg on top is always money! It was just that simple.  A burger with white cheddar cheese and an egg. Delish! Our table was pretty happy with the food and my only complaint was how I wish fries would just come with the burgers instead of being a separate charge. Really?!

Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This place was fine. Burgers were good but not the best but not the worst either. Had the philly burgers which was okay. Probably won't get it again. Wife had the English pub burger which was good. Staff was good and attentive. The burger was of good size.

Reviews.Author: Joshua
Reviews.Content: Horrible service. Cold fries. Didn't receive one single refill. Tool forever to take my order but the group of 4 that sat down 5 mins after me got their order in before I even had a drink request. Burger was mediocre. Overall disappointment.

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: The burgers here blew my mind!!!! The meat is tender, filled with flavor and seasoned to perfection. Each bite was a party in my mouth :-P. I highly recommend the salmon burger and turkey burger. In both, the meat is so tender it melts in your mouth. This place has become a must whenever I go to Vegas!

Reviews.Author: Derek
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I decided to try this place on our last trip to Vegas and were pleasantly surprised.  The burgers were delicious!  They had a very broad menu and it is really a  create your own  burger type of place.  My fiance and I enjoyed the food so much that we went back the very next night for dinner.  Burger Bar is also very reasonably priced considering that you are in Las Vegas (places like Subway and Panda Express cost $10+).  I highly recommend this place if you are looking for a relaxing place to eat on a budget, or want something to put in your stomach after doing some drinking.  Honestly, it has become one of my go to places while in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Milad
Reviews.Content: We walked into New York New York not knowing what or where we were going to eat . Stumbled upon a nice looking burger joint and we entered. The ambience was nice and we where say very quickly regardless of our party of seven. Our servers name was Kelsey and it was the first time we had been introduce by a resturuant work on a first name business. She was personable and on top of that she knew all of the beers the burger bar had on draft. As a working in the food an beverage industry this was very impressive and I admire her for going the extra mile. She answered all questions about the menu options and on top of of that she brought us all the condiments we asked for BEFORE the entrees arrived. Nothin gets me more fired up that getting my ranch thirty minutes after I get my French fries. The runner accurately gave everyone their food and apologized when he made a mistake. On to the food. The burgers where great, the garlic fries where amazing and it all came it out in an appropriate amount of time. All in all it was amazing wonderful and perfect.

Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I didn't have a great experience here, but I was so hungry i was going to settle for anything.  Two of us ordered a beef burger (medium) and it tasted like cardboard. We were just disappointed it wasn't juicy, or seasoned.  We also ordered a couple of their signature cocktails, which got us tipsy, but it tasted more like the blue agave than actual alcohol. I doubt the drinks were even mixed.  The best part of the meal was probably the chili cheese fries. Oh yeah- all of their fries were pretty good, better than their burgers.  Finally, my problem with this place was that I sat in a really sketchy chair. My lower right thigh got a rash after sitting there for an hour. It couldn't have been from anywhere else since I was standing all day at the T-Mobile center for an event. I noticed the rash once I got up to my room and showered.   Lesson learned.

Reviews.Author: Vernice
Reviews.Content: Tried this place for the first time just walking through New York New York and thought it would be good. Staff was friendly enough, and the restaurant was fairly clean. Made my own burger and ordered sweet potato fries and the burger was ok, bread was stale though, and the fries seemed a little cold. Overall was an ok experience but I probably wouldn't come back again when shake shack is right around the corner.

Reviews.Author: Smith
Reviews.Content: Food was amazing and waitress was friendly and prompt with service. Burger was cooked medium and perfect,  regular fries were really good and garlic fries were delicious with actual garlic chunks inside.

Reviews.Author: Shannan
Reviews.Content: Meh. Eh. Blah.   Before making the long drive back to LA, the 'crew' (i lack a better term) - and I were cranky, hungry and hung over and couldn't agree on a kind of food to consume. When in doubt, grab a burger. So stumbling around New York, New York - we ran into this place.   It was pretty empty so we figured we could get some food relatively quick and hit the road. Too bad that wasn't the case.   The service was ridiculous. It wasn't busy at all and there were plenty of staff around to get to us, but mannnnnnn slow is not descriptive enough. I guess everyone else was hungover too.   Anyway, I was digging the idea of grass fed beef and all that hipster burger-ness that I adore. Too bad it didn't deliver.  My burger was on the dry side (so much for med rare), the bun was a bit day old feeling and the flavors were gamey and over seasoned. Damn it. I hate when I waste calories on bad food.   Also, one of the burger options says 'avocado' whereas another option is 'guacamole' so I assumed that there were two options. Nope - no avocado. Stooopid.  But the guac was fresh - I have to give it to them on that.  (However, that begs the question of whether it was homemade...which means I could have had avocado plain, right? - anyway.)  ON THE POSITIVE: The bacon was thick and tasty and the fries were very tasty and real. Made from actual taters. Appreciation for that.

Reviews.Author: dustyq
Reviews.Content: Good burgers and salads. Onion rings way too thick. Chili fries - just ok.

Reviews.Author: Monica
Reviews.Content: My family of four really enjoyed our burgers! Our waiter, Ben, was so  attentive, pleasant, professional and knowledgeable about the menu. We had a delicious lunch!

Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: We grabbed dinner here our first night in Vegas. It was fine; no complaints here. The burgers were cooked like we like and they tasted good, portions were plenty. However, I think next time we are here we might try a different spot if we want burgers. It was a bit pricey for having to order fries, etc., on the side (For $10-15, you just get the burger). Plus, I think you could find something more unique.

Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: The burgers here were really good.  Our server was attentive and efficient.  The fries come in their own little baskets, which was a cute touch.  The only thing we would do differently would be that we would only order one burger & fries and split it.  The burgers were huge and the french fry portions were too.  They use very good quality beef for their burgers, and it shows with the very first yummy bite.

Reviews.Author: Corrina
Reviews.Content: We brought a party of 5 to lunch here and really enjoyed the experience.  We ordered 3 different burgers, the Ahi and the Smoked Chicken salad, all excellent, especially the panko breaded goat cheese accompaniment. Very decadent.  The Manager, Jeff, was very gracious and visited with our Mom and Aunt and made excellent suggestions for our drink and dessert choices. We stayed at the table and visited for quite awhile and never felt rushed by the wait staff.

Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: Had to stop in here at 4am because America was closed for cleaning (is that a metaphor? an allegory? HELP WHAT'S THE WORD I'M LOOKING FOR!?). I ordered a ham and cheese omelet with a side of fries. I wish I could post a photo to this review (and, who knows, maybe on the mobile app I can) but it was the most wan-looking, unappetizing omelet I've consumed in a very long time. The side of hash browns was bigger than said omelet, and not very exciting. I asked for hot sauce and the server brought me about 7 varieties of Tobasco. That was why this place gets 2 stars instead of 1.  Service was fine. I think my guy's name was James? He was working there instead of America because I guess the whole staff moved during the cleaning and was operating out of the Burger Bar's kitchen...but only serving the Burger Bar's menu? Yeah, I was just as confused as you were, and I was about 12 Jack-and-Cokes deep at that point. Honestly, I just wanted the gravy fries from America but I had to settle for this instead. Also when I received my place setting there was no fork. I was simply given a knife wrapped up inside a napkin. It was almost as if someone was trying to tell me,  It's 4am and you're wasted, eating an omelet and fries by yourself in a corner booth at a 24-hour diner. Kill yourself.   Obviously I didn't, because I'm here writing this review...  ...From beyond the grave!!! OOoooooOOooOoooOOOhhhh...

Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: Fantastic burger and fries.  I stopped by there today and got the mushroom and Swiss burger and it was amazing! The meat was very thick and cooked perfectly, the mushrooms were sautéed just right and the cheese was a big thick slice of the best tasting Swiss you'll ever eat. The fries were crispy and very well seasoned.  By the way, forgot to mention, but the above was so great, even after I got it to go and drove home 25 minutes!  To all the people who want to stand outside Shake Shack in the cold for 20 minutes for a tiny burger no more impressive than a Big Mac, do your taste buds a favor and step inside the NY NY and get a REAL burger!

Reviews.Author: East Bay
Reviews.Content: The turkey burger is still one of the best I've ever had.  Careful, though; one of those and some onion rings and some of your wife's fries is a successful recipe for one serious gut bomb.

Reviews.Author: Brandi
Reviews.Content: The service here was spectacular and the environment was so much fun with a group. We sat at the bar and the french fries were some of the best I have ever had. They also have a crazy extensive list of condiments!!

Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS FOOD SERVED UP HOT AND FRESH in a good mock up of a NY subway station in the New York New York casino.  We started with an order of fried pickles, which were YUM!! Kosher dill spears in a crispy wet cornmeal batter had been fried perfectly. They come with ranch, but I liked mine better without the ranch so all that big pickle flavor could shine through!  I got the Swiss and Mushroom burger, which was cooked perfectly medium rare just as I had asked. I am so used to getting medium burgers (ordered medium rare) that I was thrilled!!   Apart from being cooked correctly, the need was well seasoned with salt and pepper, came with a generous amount of delicious sautéed mushrooms (crimini and shiitake), and a flavorful melted aged Swiss on a toasted fresh-baked bun. Just a delicious burger - the best I've had in a long time.   Others at the table enjoyed their Italian burger, which came with a delicious thick Parmesan cheese crisp that was to die for!!   We would definitely come back, EXCEPT we had to walk through the casino to et to the food court in back. Smoking is allowed in Las Vegas casinos, and by the time we were in and out, my asthmatic girls had breathed in so much smoke that they both needed nebulizer treatments. Even the one whose asthma is well controlled needed a treatment -- that's how bad the combined cigar and cigarette smoke in the casino is, despite a massive HVAC system. The air in the food court (nonsmoking) was VASTLY better, but be damage had been done and the girl's chests were feeling the effects.   What a shame we can't come back -- the food was delicious, service friendly and efficient, and atmosphere interesting and exciting.

Reviews.Author: Zach
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly decent burger, and very good service! And fair prices at that.   Our group of 6 were sat immediately on a Saturday evening...albeit a very quiet Saturday by Vegas standards. Looking over the beer menu, we were very impressed with the selection and price - tasty beers for decent (Strip-wise) prices.   I had a Greek burger with onion rings. The burger itself came in a pita with tzatziki, and I ordered it with feta cheese (which I don't believe is on the menu, but they have it). It was very, very good. The onion rings were okay...not the most flavorful, but fine.  Everyone else enjoyed their burgers, but I was so in to mine that I don't remember what they had.   One negative is that they only give you burgers done, I believe, medium or well. Clearly assembly line burgers, but so be it. Medium is usually too done for me, but when there is no choice, there's no choice.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: One word. Nasty! Take a walk to burger bar at Mandalay shoppes better service and way better food!!!!

Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: Broadway is reasonably priced overall, but what made it better was that their servings are so big.  With 4 people we ended up just ordering 2 burgers and 2 fries.  We all left stuffed!  Quality burgers freshly made!  The onion rings were good, as were the sweet potato fries.  Best part - you can customize your burger!  Service was also outstanding!

Reviews.Author: Nahnia
Reviews.Content: I would never eat here again. Extremely expensive and charges you for everything. $4 for an iced tea? $5 for fries and drink upgrade. Had the Philly Cheese steak, kids mac and cheese, and Pork sliders with onion rings. Pork sliders were on Kings Hawaiian rolls, 2 sliders for $6. After eating them I think they are worth about $3. Philly Cheese steak burger was just a cheese burger really. Service was horrible. Our waitress came around twice. The kids mac and cheese was kraft from the box and a large pile of fries for $6, but honestly I think he made out the best of all of us. Even the onion rings were raw and had a fishy flavor like the oil was tainted.

Reviews.Author: Jeanna
Reviews.Content: Deeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeelicious!  Broadway Burger Bar & Grill is where I devoured one of the best tasting burgers in my life!  Do I remember what it was? Noooooooo... but it had bacon on it, and cheese.  Their garlic french fries were divine, and they even served a brand of root beer that I had never heard of before for my root beer float.  That just means it's really authentic, really old, or... really cheap.  The friend I was with loved what she ordered as well.  The waitress set us up on a four-top, half booth half stand alone chairs, and we could look out at the casino.  That was cool.  The restaurant wasn't very crowded so I was pretending she set us up there on account of how purdy we looked that day.  I do remember paying something like $40 for everything - everything being two burgers, an order or fries, a beer and the aforementioned root beer float.  Sounds about right for a restaurant, ya?  The noise level is pretty average, where we were sitting by the kitchen anyway.  You sort of get used to the singing of slot machines while inside any casino so someone with a sensitivity to noise might think other than me. However, I do feel that where we were sitting (and you can completely see it if you go in there - it's a four-top half booth/half stand alone chairs, leaning up against the kitchen) was devoid of any distractions at all.  And I was probably hungover.  For a hungover person to think it's quiet, then I'd say you can trust that judgment.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our party didn't notice the condiment menu until after our burgers were served, but overall we enjoyed our food. We just had to ask for condiments afterward.  Service was on point.  I ordered the upside down pineapple cake cocktail  and it was delicious. They only give you a choice of medium rare or well done on your burgers, which may be a good thing because I ordered mine medium rare and it was perfect.

Reviews.Author: Veronica
Reviews.Content: Not sure what was dyer their burger or their service.. I ordered the cowboy burger, it dry as can be flavor was lacking big time. I found out later its suppose to be a healthy burger joint had I known that I wouldn't have went. The waitress was dry no personality like she hated her job or just got dumped.. either way don't kill me vibe. all around bad time will not be back

Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: Late night service, veggie burger served in a pita with yogurt sauce...how can you go wrong? Not only was the food DELICIOUS, the waitress anticipated what the BF and I needed before we had to ask and apologized for the wait several times even though I didn't  notice we were waiting. Love it!

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Have it your way - starting with the burger itself: Beef, Chicken, Salmon, Turkey, or Veggie. I started with the desire of a salmon burger and added bacon and cheese. The result was a pretty close to perfect combination where the salmon was surprising juicy for being ground.  Service was great - both quick and attentive. I would definitely return for a quick casual meal in the future.

Reviews.Author: Tim
Reviews.Content: I was at the New York New York with a friend to have a great time and grab a bite to eat. No other restaurant looked appetizing but when we were greeted by Dawn as we walked by the Broadway Burger Bar and Grill, we knew we found the spot. Her knowledge of the menu, the way she controlled her bar and coworkers was amazing. It was a great time and ended up with excellent food, all at Dawn's recommendation.   I will be back and because of Dawn, I will recommend this restaurant to all my friends who frequent Las Vegas. Thanks Dawn!

Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: If you just want a good ole burger that is not fancied up like these Vegas gourmet joints, this is the place. I had the ground chicken blta burger and it was delicious. Better than a turkey burger. Big size and fresh. Can't ask for more.

Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I'm in town for a pharmacy conference that is taking place this week in Las Vegas and let me tell you how hard it is to find a spot to eat without a wait.  A good spot that pumps out good appropriate quality food and at a reasonable price! This is what the Broadway Burger Bar & Grill accomplishes and what makes it a great venue to stop by and check out.  I went with the mushroom swiss burger which was highly recommended by previous yelp users and I must say it is a pretty darn good mushroom swiss burger! And if you're like me who has a ton of questions about what to order the staff will help you out with ease.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Decent food. Had the philly burger and garlic fries. Person I was with got the convoy burger that looked better. Good beef though.

Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: Garlic fries are a must and a place that serves arrogant bastard on tap has to be pretty good.  Wife and I ordered the cowboy and mushroom burger.  Holy cow!  Awesome and good riddance of the old place yeah it was cheaper but you skimped on taste and quality

Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Not very good. My friends and I were hungry, and we mistakenly chose the first place we could find. All five of us felt like our burgers were dry, when we ordered medium, and that the buns tasted borderline stale. We all left unsatisfied.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie
Reviews.Content: First of all the host didn't even greet us until we said something and then she walked us to our table with no smile and just threw down the menu and walked away. Then the server took forever to come to our table to take our order and the food took EVEN LONGER we waited over 30 minutes for less than mediocre burgers. We ordered the Philly Cheesesteak burger and all I tasted was the dry tasteless beef patty and nothing else. The Chicken BLTG was no different it was just dry and bland. The burgers are definitely not worth the price of $11-13. We were not satisfied at all after the meal. We then sat for another 10 minutes in order to get the check. The only positive thing was the server was nice. This place was one of the worst places in Las Vegas that I have eaten at out of all the Burger Places on the strip.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: After watching the 10:00pm show of Zumanity, Minh D and i were in total need of a snack before meeting up with Lucy Y, David G and my friend Ashley for some drinks. Since this was my first time inside of New York-New York hotel i had no clue what was here. Decided on going here since it was protein and they didnt have a wait time. Checked in with the hostess and she seated us right away. The burger bar was on the large side with lots of tables and booths to sit at. Our waitress was sweet and gave us more then enough time to look over their menu. After tossing back and forth ideas on what we wanted, we decided on splitting a Bacon and Cheese Turkey burger (Turkey breast, ground and seasoned with fresh carrots, onions, parsley and spices. Crisp applewood-smoked bacon and American cheese)  The burger was kind of on the smaller side but enough to split between two people and fill their tummys up for awhile. I was impressed with the taste of the Turkey burger itself (i know i always repeat that i hate a dry tasting burger especially a Turkey burger) but this was a wow factor the spices and onions made the taste really pop! Sad to say but the bacon was overcooked and small.  Overlooking the small stuff the burger was pretty tasty and made me happy and looking forward to a night of random fun!!!!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I had the salmon shrimp burger  (which had a  Cajun flavor to it) with a side of garlic fries.  I must say that the burger was really good. The garlic fries were good as well but too garlicky and all the garlic was at the bottom of the basket and not enough mixed around. I probably would come to have the burger again. The service was good and very welcoming.

Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Offically, this is blind suqirrel finding nut, well actually to die for burger.  So, Mr Tourist goes to Vegas and spents eight hours in airports to eat a Pastrami Burger at Ameirica, different restuarant.  Which happened to close post superbowl or yesterday.  Mark is now in search for anything burger like. On tuesday night, the place was half full but its a casino so gamblers are busy elsewhere.  Now this is my first time ever hearing the term Estancia beef  (from Uruguay), it is damn near perfect.  Okay, besides the obvious burger choices the menu includes Black & Blue (with Roquefort cheese), English pub burger with grill tomato and egg, Southwestern with jalopena bacon & guac, & Philly Cheesesteak Burger (with shaved ribeye steak).  I opted for Black & Blue, it came straight down from burger heaven.  A fine pink stripe as ordered medium, lots of Roquefort cheese oozing off and I attempted to eat it. The Philly Cheese steak burger was very good, too.  Both were very juicy, needed plenty of extra napkins!!  And if you must have fries with burger (like its optional), go for garlic fries.  They have an interesting way of making them, they use minced garlic!!!  Lots of garlic and one serving was more than enough for two. You can get about 6 differnet mustards and four types of mayo.  But like is not all burgers, they have beer! On draft varieties includ Stone Arrogant Bastard Ale, Full Sail Amber Ale, Rogue Dead Guy Ale, Abita Turbodog Brown Ale, Three monkeys Nut Brown Ale, and the list goes on to less important beers.  Really nice  little  place in Mega Casino Land.  Great staff, quick service, friendly and helpful with selections.  So if you're in Las Vegas and need a burger in the worst way, head to New York New York.  And if you dont want a burger they will prepare chickie, turkey,  salmon, and veggie patties the same way.All burgers $10-$13.

Reviews.Author: Greg
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I ate here (for the second time) in June 2016. We both had a burger, fries and soft drink for ~$25 all in. Food was tasty, service was fast and friendly, and the street-like atmosphere is pretty cool.  https://www.tripadvisor.ca/ShowUserReviews-g45963-d2000144-r387461799-Broadway_Burger_Bar_and_Grill-Las_Vegas_Nevada.html#

Reviews.Author: Miranda
Reviews.Content: The fries are definitely the biggest wow factor at this place. Amazing, hand cut, thick, crispy fries are served in a baby fryer basket and one order seemed enough for 2 people to share with our burgers.   I had the chicken BLTA and the bf had one of their burgers. Both were delicious. Like many reviews say, they are on the small side... but I'd rather have portion control versus an overly stuffed tummy or a to-go box.   I guess you could say our meal was a bit expensive ($33 + tip for 2 burgers, 2 iced teas & one fry), but HELLO......it's in the middle of the NY NY casino. People seem to forget they are also paying for the convenience as well as the atmosphere.   Recommended!!

Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Don't bother with the happy hour unless you're wanting beer only. You only get two sliders so don't order if you're hungry.

Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Food was mediocre and greasy.  The service was flat-out rude, and she was condescending/sarcastic when we asked for recommendations on what to order.  DO NOT go when Dawn is working the bar.  I read another review where she wouldn't replace a spilled beer like a decent bartender.  Horrible service.  I won't be bringing my friends here when they come to visit Las Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Had the bacon and cheese burger combo. Great food, fast service and great atmosphere. Also had the B3&G tea. A different twist on the Long Island Iced Tea. Thought it was a great drink. The price was reasonable. Also tried the Pineapple Upside Down Cake drink and loved it

Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: Great burgers! Good service! Nice juicy meat tasted great! Our waitress recommended the Southwestern and did not disappoint! Will be back again!

Reviews.Author: Jency
Reviews.Content: The worst service ever. Waited 45 mins for a damn burger and the manager did nothing about. Never eat here they suck.

Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: 3.5 stars.  Ended up coming here twice during my weekend at Vegas. The first time my bf and I had some time to kill before Zumanity so we stopped by for drinks. I ended up getting a shake after I took a gander at their menu. Ben and Jerry's shakes for the win! It was minty chocolately goodness. Yum!  The next day we visited again to actually have lunch. I started with a bloody mary and ordered a Greek turkey burger - served on pita bread with some greek salad and tzatziki. The turkey patty was on the salty side but as a whole, the burger was pretty good. The bloody mary was very run of the mill. Nowhere near as much horseradish or kick as I like to have in my bloody marys. Service was attentive and food came out in a timely manner. Good spot to hang and eat with friends in Vegas if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Author: Kara
Reviews.Content: Only stopped by the bar for a drink, so don't have much to comment on. Good prices on beer, great service. Pickle fries are a MUST!  Fried pickles, but the spears have been cut thinner so they are easier to eat! Was loud as roller coaster loading/unloading station was right above bar.

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Stopped in before our we went to see Zumanity. Their menu is pretty basic and moderately expensive for what it is. Most likely wouldn't go again based on lack of selection on the menu and lack of flavor. Basic burger joint even though I ended up ordering a Caesar salad

Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: Service was good but the food was absolutely blan and left a lot to be desired. There are much better burger joints on the strip!

Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: I love this place! It's tucked away in NY NY so it's relatively quiet and commotion free. The burgers are great, the onion rings are great, the beer is great and the service is great. I now make it a point to come here at least once every time I'm in Vegas.

Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: What a terrible way to be lectured by the hostess.  She reprimanded me for looking at there display of 20 +\- condiments.  You would of thought I just crashed a vehicle into her and was drunk.    Was one of my worst all time interactions between a hostess as a patron in my 56 years on the planet.  Had it not been for the beer battered onion rings I would of left.    She told me I had no business standing there looking at there 20 condiments as they would bring it to me.  I was in a location where I wasn't allowed, she stated in front of her staff.  Go figure it was not inside the kitchen and it was a lecture from not a kind hearted staff member.   She knows her job but never again.  Learn how to speak to your guest and Management take notice.

Reviews.Author: Tobby
Reviews.Content: We had the turkey burger southwest style. Food was good but the presentation weird. They served the burger on a different plate than the bun. Our server was nice and had great recommendations for additions.

Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: Tasteless burger..on a gluten free bunch and the cheddar cheese had no flavor either..i might as well have been eating a grilled soul off my shoe...French fries the bartender told me they were hand cut and fresh...But of course they came out all wilted and thats not how fries should be if they know what they are doing....ill pass on this joint...

Reviews.Author: Raj
Reviews.Content: Zumanity burger Cajun salmon burger Long wait for food Soggy fries Burgers were good Pickle is good

Reviews.Author: Jessie
Reviews.Content: I went to Broadway Burger Bar & Grill with my husband, his brother and his brother's girlfriend on a Saturday evening before seeing Zumanity. I am going to need to revisit Broadway Burger Bar & Grill sober so that I can write an update... I was pretty Jagered up by the time we arrived, and can't even comment on the burger I had (I will spare you all the details, haha!). I wasn't too drunk to notice a few things though!    Likes:  Prices weren't bad, considering it was a casino on the Strip.  There was no wait to be seated at 8 pm on a Saturday night.  Options for turkey and veggie burgers, variety is always a plus.   Dislikes:  I had to ask for water multiple times before I got it. My husband also asked for waters for the table. I was the only one that got a water, after asking again...  And I REALLY needed some water!!! When my husband asked for his burger to be medium well he was told his options were medium or well, nothing else.  Most of the beers that our table requested were not available. Having a decent selection of good beers means nothing if the ones people order are not actually available.   The garlic and herb fries smelled fantastic but I found the flavor to be a little weak. Maybe it was the booze messing with my tastebuds though?? They don't skimp on the amount of fries, consider splitting an order if you aren't a heavy eater. My brother in law RAVED about his burger, he even said it was the best he ever ate. That may have been the whiskey talking though...  My husband devoured his burger as well, and commented that he could really tell the meat was good quality.   Since the guys were so happy with their meals, I would definitely be down to go back sometime... When I am a little less lubrucated of course!

Reviews.Author: Jayson
Reviews.Content: Excellent house  salad with croutons that are homemade .  amazing onion rings we will be back the next time we're in Vegas. Sheba was doing great

Reviews.Author: Solomon
Reviews.Content: After walking around for a bit, you may find yourself at Broadway Burger. While my friends were a little put off by the simplicity of the menu, sometimes it is better to do a few things quite well. Our server, David, approached us with a no-nonsense advice of someone who read us as out of towners. Again, put off my friends. I took his recommendation of the berry cooler and the Philly Cheesesteak burger. It was everything he promised. I also took his recommendation to add a little horseradish to the burger. Exquisite.

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: ***** 10% Locals Discount *****  Broadway Burger Bar is located inside the New York New York Casino over near the Zumanity theater and Race and Sports Book.   After reading some of the reviews, I wasn't quite sure what to expect in terms of service. I have to say that we were quite pleased with the service we received here. Our hostess greeted us with a smile and promptly seated us. The waitress followed shortly thereafter and took our orders. I decided to play it safe and just get a cheeseburger($9.95) and fries($2.95), while my friend opted for the chili cheese burger($11.50).   Both of our burgers were quite tasty and the patties were so thick and juicy! They seem to take great pride in the fact that their burgers are 100% free-range, grass fed Estancia beef.  This means they are all natural with no hormones and no antibiotics! Nice! Fries were nothing spectacular, but the portion size was healthy.  We were checked on repeatedly by our waitress and never had to ask for our drinks to be topped off. We were very pleased with the service here.  I noticed some people complained about the prices, but considering you are on the strip, the prices are not bad at all. Actually it's not too much more than you would pay at a Chili's or Applebee's off the strip...so suck it up,cupcake!  I would definitely come back here again for a quick, casual bite to eat if I find myself in NY-NY again!   4 stars.

Reviews.Author: Paula
Reviews.Content: Standard burger. The garlic fries were good and I was impressed that they actually mixed in the garlic and just didn't plop a pile straight on top. We came for an early lunch (just got off the plane) so the service was pretty quick. Decent through and through.

Reviews.Author: Jenny
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything wrong with Broadway Burger, per say, but there isn't anything awesome about it either. They have a decent selection of burgers and salads that you can customize. If you are familiar with The Counter, it is sort of like that, but not as awesome.  The service is really friendly and accommodating. I ended up giving my server a really generous tip because she did such an awesome job with a smile.   The food gets the job done, but it really is nothing to write home about. I felt that I could have done better for my vacation. Then again, I'm not a big burger person and mostly went there because a friend wanted to get a chicken burger (that she didn't like). Meh.

Reviews.Author: Nika
Reviews.Content: After walking by Broadway Burger Bar & Grill on our first day in Vegas, I knew I had to come back and try it out. It's a really cute little restaurant in the NY, NY hotel and I had high hopes for it being great! However, as much as I wanted to like it, it was honestly a bit disappointing. The service was a little too careless and slow (we waited for a loooong time for water refills and the food itself), and the food a little too tasteless, and the prices too high... So overall, though the location and decor was cute, everything else was kind of blech.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: This is my new favorite Burger place! I don't eat red meat very often, but when it is organic free range burger  and  organic ketchup....you gotta try it!!  I got the Italian Burger with Tropical Tea~ Amazing is all I have to say!

Reviews.Author: Teressa
Reviews.Content: This place is in New York New York. They allowed us to bring our stroller when other places wouldn't. The lady that helped us was rad and went out of her way to make the kids happy. The burgers were perfect. They were juicy and the best. It was amazing. The side salad was great as well.

Reviews.Author: Nicole Renee
Reviews.Content: We stumbled there craving a good burger, that is what we got!!  The waite staff was good and tolerated our boisterous behavior. The food came in a resonable time and everything was cooked to our liking. The garlic fries were incredibly good (althought I did need a mint later) just the right amount of garlic.   Two in our party had the turkey burger and said it was moist, which is not always the case in other places. I had the range and hormone free beef. It was full of flavor.  I'd go again and recommend others

Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: Grass fed beef. Can't go wrong there. No complaints about the burger. The beef was juicy and the jalapeño bacon had exactly enough heat. Just wished the fries had a little more seasoning, though.

Reviews.Author: yessenia
Reviews.Content: I had THE COWBOY! The burger meat was nice and thick. But a little dry so I asked for extra bbq. The fries were some of the best I've had as well as as the chilli. The cheese tasted like nacho cheese, and that threw me off. The service was great, and they were always on top of our drinks and food.

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: Like almost every review on here my experience was average. Good service. Attentive very nice server. Unfortunately the food was limited in selection, dry, bland, and forgettable. So much so in fact that i had to set a reminder to write this review. Good concept, poor execution

Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: This was my first place to Eat at when I came to Las Vegas. As soon as we walked in New York New York, we Immediately wanted to find a Place to Eat, so after almost 10 Minutes of walking around we found this place we were sat immediately.   you get to choose from 24 different Burgers, My dad got the Smokehouse Burger (Shaved Brisket, Chipotle BBQ Sauce and a Grilled Pineapple Cole Slaw), Heat from the BBQ Sauce and Acidity from the Slaw. I got the Cuban Burger (Roasted Pork, Shaved Ham, Pickles, Swiss Cheese and Mustard) I forgot to tell her to hold the Pickles so I took them off myself (No Harm to the Burger) plus I told them to put Brie Cheese on my Burger (Nutty, Gooey, Creamy) and told them to take off the Swiss (A Very Big Burger with a Ton of Meat (the thing was bigger than my Mouth and it was a real Gut Filler).  We also split a basket of Jalapeno Garlic Fries (Hand Cut Fries, Minced Garlic and a ton of Jalapeno Slices) with every bite I got hit with a good amount of Heat (in a Good Way). Such an awesome first stop on my Trip to Vegas. Hope to get another Burger Next Time !!!

Reviews.Author: Ashlee
Reviews.Content: Good burgers +good service =happy tummy   The burgers are amazing.  Server Dave was helpful!  And the salad look delicious! Good service

Reviews.Author: Felicia
Reviews.Content: They just reopened this spot, after months of renovation. Now it is a more proper sit down diner. You check in, the host seats you- that kind of thing.   The food is so mediocre, I'd eat at Carls, and Mc'Dees before here.

Reviews.Author: Winston
Reviews.Content: For all the great reviews on Yelp I was disappointed.  Especially when I looked in the kitchen to see the head Chef chomping on a Big piece of gum, with his mouth open!  The burger was pretty good but not that special.  The onion rings were just okay too.  My wife and I split a burger, onion rings and a shake.  The only thing we finished was the Ben n Jerry's shake.  We could have gotten just that across the hall at Ben N Jerry's and avoided the burger that is priced for 2 but sized for 1, even if we didn't finish it.  It was anticlimactic after reading all the great the reviews here and Google.  Good burger but nothing special.  The cheapest burger is $10.50 and has No meat if that tells you about pricing.  Maybe the chef missed the special sauce on ours?

Reviews.Author: Chase
Reviews.Content: Dirty  Sat down.  Silverware had goop on it.   wiped it with the napkin, and it smudged.  so it wasn't baked on goop, it was soft goop.  Given plates.  same thing.  goop on it.  wiped it, it smudged.  TOP IT OFF - server brings out my burger.  Just as she rounds the corner when they punch in the orders, she coughs over my burger.  she doesn't turn her head, doesn't cover her mouth, doesn't move the burger.  The brunette server with the crooked face, and lazy,  i don't give a F*@!  expression.  Someone in the food industry should come nowhere close to what she did.  Tony, the manager, was cool.  My waiter was cool.  But place needs to clean house.

Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: Surprised by the poor reviews. My friend and I thought this place was great. We both had the turkey burgers which were cooked perfectly and very moist which can be hard to find with turkey burgers. They also had a good special where you got a burger, fries and a drink for 14.99. A good deal for dinner in Vegas. The fries were great and they have a huge selection of burger toppings and sauces. Quite good! I also love the location in New York, New York.

Reviews.Author: Thomas
Reviews.Content: Auf der Suche nach einem guten Burger am Strip bin ich im New York New York gelandet. Eigentlich passend zum Thema, sollte man denken. Die Pommes waren stark verbrannt, beinahe schwarz (auch an den Nachbartischen). Der Burger schmeckte sehr fad, das Fleisch nicht wirklich frisch. Die 2 Sterne gibt's für die schöne Atmosphäre und die freundliche Bedienung.

Reviews.Author: Jesse
Reviews.Content: Been here twice and liked it both times. Waitress was attentive. The onion rings & fries were fresh and the burgers were good. The setup is visually interesting, because you're in the part of the casino that looks like scaled-down city streets. It's slightly diner-esque but that theme is not too heavy-handed. They use cloth napkins, which is nice. They use real chili on the chili fries, but not real cheese (but maybe that's a regional thing?) The menu is one page: types of burger patties (they also have salmon, turkey, and portobello burgers), types of toppings, and types of fries. Desserts and cocktails are available, but they only have about 4 options for each (Long Island Iced Tea is on the menu, of course). It's not a problem, because there are dessert places right next to it. This place is really about the burgers. It was $50 for 2 people, without cocktails or dessert, but hey (shrug) you're in a tourist hotspot, so you're going to pay more.

Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: On our visit our waitress Lawshanda was very attentive, super nice and provided fast and courteous service! Great food, great experience!!

Reviews.Author: Joel
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for a late lunch after picking up Zumanity tickets at the NYNY box office which is literally right next to this restaurant. The restaurant is spacious and clean, service was quick and friendly, prices were comparable to any burger place on the strip. The food was delicious. I ordered the burger with French fries, aged white cheddar, and a fried egg on top. Recommended by the waitress I also added bacon. Delicious!!! This is a tasty and convenient spot I'd recommend for lunch.
